xxl.core.pipes.operators.joins
Class MultiWayEquiJoin<I,O>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,O>
          xxl.core.pipes.operators.joins.MultiWayEquiJoin<I,O>
All Implemented Interfaces:
MemoryManageable, MemoryMonitorable, Pipe<I,O>, Node, Sink<I>, Source<O>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class MultiWayEquiJoin<I,O>
extends AbstractPipe<I,O>
implements MemoryManageable

Operator component in a query graph that performs a join operation over two or more input streams.

Since:
1.1

Constructor Detail

MultiWayEquiJoin

public MultiWayEquiJoin(Source<? extends I>[] sources,
                        int[] IDs,
                        SweepArea[] sweepAreas,
                        Function[] makeSAMemoryManageable,
                        Function newResult)
Constructs a new MultiJoin. Wraps the SweepAreas to MemoryManageable ones using the specified function array makeSAMemoryManageable.

Parameters:
sources - The join sources in the query graph
IDs - IDs of the sources
sweepAreas - the SweepAreas
makeSAMemoryManageable - Unary function that wraps a SweepArea to a MemoryManageable-SweepArea.
newResult - Function that produces a result tuple

MultiWayEquiJoin

                        int[] IDs,
                        MemoryManageable[] sweepAreas,
                        Function newResult)
Method Detail

getObjectSize

public int getObjectSize()
Description copied from interface: MemoryManageable
Returns the estimated size of the objects which are stored in the memory of this memory monitorable object. This method can be called from the strategy of the memory manager to obtain useful information for distributing main memory among the memory using objects.

Specified by:
getObjectSize in interface MemoryManageable
Returns:
Returns the size of a single object (in bytes).

Specified by:
getPreferredMemSize in interface MemoryManageable
Returns:
Returns the preferred amount of memory (in bytes).

processObject

public void processObject(I o,
                          int ID)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
Calls insert to insert the element into the correct sweep area, then calls computeResults to generate any join results.

Specified by:
processObject in class AbstractPipe<I,O>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - One of the IDs this pipe specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

insert

protected void insert(I o,
                      int j)
Inserts the specified element into the specified sweep area.

Parameters:
o - Element to be inserted
j - Index (not ID!) of sweep area to be inserted into

computeResults

protected void computeResults(Object o,
                              int j,
                              Predicate predicate)
Generates the join results for the specified incoming element.

Parameters:
o - Element to generate results with
j - Index (not ID!) of input stream the element comes from
